review: We ate here on New Year's eve. I was surprised that it was not as crowded as I thought it would be. However that said, they were busy enough and the food this visit, because we had visited here several times before, was the best we've had yet!  We had the ribs we had one with the Jack Daniels sauce and the other one without. Both were great but I definitely recommend the Jack Daniels sauce! Our waitress that we had, was excellent. She was very attentive but not intrusive that we enjoyed our meal. In the many places that we've gone to have food this was one of the top five waitresses we had so far!  Our waitress told us about the dinner, appetizer and drink specials, but since we were going home to drink at New Year's we did not indulge in the drink specials.   Based on our past meals here and combined with our latest meal we are giving us four stars, but we may up it to five stars if the service continues as good as it did this latest visit.

The server was very good considering the amount of people in the restaurant  The atmosphere was ok but the TVs were too loud which makes a hard to have a conversation with who ever you are with  Cleanness of the place were pretty good  Food presentation awful, food were cold , stale , taste were not as a expected.  The drinks were pretty good but they should do better  The server at any moment came to us to find out wether we were satisfied with the service  The place is a bit too dark should be a bit more illuminated since is daytime  Overall will not recommend to anyone  There's too many other places you can spend your money and have a better service
Absolutely horrible, do not go here.  Place was dead slow and it took them 30 minutes to get appetizers.  Soups were sour and curdled.  Staff is rude and incompetent.  Utensils were dirty.

Went for happy hour bar area was empty but yet we waited long for our drinks waited over ten min for soup that was cold then waited another 15 min for appetizers and the order was wrong the service was horrible we arrived at 3:15 pm did not leave till well over 5pm just for two drinks and some appetizers in an empty bar area

They have an interesting Jack Daniels selection but everything else is mediocre. For some reason, I always end up having to steal silverware from a nearby table when I come here. Unless it's the "new thing" to eat with your hands?

Came here for lunch on a Wednesday. It was pretty empty. The lady in the front was nice and we got seated right away. Our waitress was not in a good mood because I saw her arguing maybe a supervisor or something, but she was nice to us. Besides not really smiling, she was polite when she spoke to us. They got my bf's drink wrong but she changed it right away. His mom's drink had practically all ice. She finished the drink in 5 sips. The spinach dip was good. I had the chicken bruschetta pasta which came out good.j
I went to TGIF this past weekend and it was horrible. The wait time was atrocious, the food was disgusting and the sfaff sucked. I am never coming back!

Not my first time coming here. Just so happens that  there were a few issues. There were three of us today. We were seated almost right away. Our server was very nice although she seemed like she may just had a couple cups of coffee. Ordered wings, the lobster and steak and the finally the ribs and shrimp entree with various lemonade drink mixtures.  First issue is that one of my guest asked for wild rice which they didn't have and instead of checking she was given white rice. Wasn't much of a big deal at first. The second issue was the ribs and shrimp entree. I ended up getting just ribs with 2 sides. Upon asking if my ribs came with shrimp I was told they'd be right out. They were brought out 12 minutes 32 seconds later piping hot which I learnt upon attempting to try one. At. this point my meal was pretty much completed. Ended having to let them sit for a while before I could eat them.  Once the check came however I was charged separately for my meal. In the past if a server was going to do this they made sure to inform me. Usually I wouldn't be too bothered but considering that I stated both when I was ordering as well as after my meal came that I was expecting the entree that came with shrimp and not two separate orders I was more than a little upset. As a former server and a business owner anything that affects or changes the bill of the client is usually something you inform them about. Upon questioning about this I was told it's a common mistake and she didn't know which I wanted and that they couldn't do anything about it.  I think that statement in itself contradicts with good customer service. Assuming you have multiple things on the menu your job as a server is to clarify which and common practice to repeat the order. If I order wings you don't guess at which sauce I want it in. Used to be a regular but I might take a break for a while not sure if I'll be back but I work near the area often so we'll see.

Terrible experience, I been to this place plenty of times and tonight the food was terrible. Not only was the waiter very dirty and sweaty looking, but service was horrible. The special was salty and very plain, I will never come back to this place. I suggest a cleaning service to come in ASAP!!!!

For a day that was not busy, they were really unorganized. The server would take our order and when the items came one thing was always missing. Ordered drink forget one, order entrée forget one.  Ordered a burger medium well, it was still mooing when they brought it to the table.  Waited 7 minutes  then was told it will take another 10 min. I just canceled the order because by time it gets there the rest of the party would have to wait for me to eat.  He still brings out and was like you sure you still don't want it.  Yes I'm sure that why I said to cancel it 10 min ago.  He did try to redeem himself by giving the kids desserts for free. The whole experience left a bad taste in my mouth. Oh yeah the the grey goose lemonade was all lemonade and no grey goose.

This location used to be my favorite Friday night spot. So of course on a random night when looking for a last minute spot to connect with a friend I suggested this restaurant. The server was kind , event with the strong cigarette smoke permeating from his person, but the service was slow. We both ordered the app combo with wings, potato skins and pot stickers. The wings tasted and appearred  to have been reheated multiple times they were so dry, the skins were overcooked with little yo no cheese... I didnt even bother with the pot stickers. To make it worse, I couldn't even wash it down with my margarita as their was a hair floating in my beverage. I returned the drink and gave up on the food. Such a disappointing experience and a total waste of my funds. Won't make this mistake again.

Food was disgusting. Had the chicken bruschetta pasta. It took us literally about 45 minutes just for the food to come out. Once it came I had about to scoops. It was nasty. I'm honestly not a fan of Friday's food. I've literally tried everything in the menu and nothing ever is tasty to me. Our server was super nice and she gave me a Friday's gift card because I didn't like my food. That was really nice. Also had a drink it was tasty.

I have been going to this TGI Fridays location for years, and it has always been one of my favorite go-to spots for my friends and I. The wings are a TGI Fridays staple and I usually order them with a meal and they're always good. I visited this location with my boyfriend today, and it was not the best experience. Once seated, we waited for over 20 minutes for a server to come to our table. Eventually a woman came over to our table (She looked like she may have been a manager, I'm not sure) to serve us. She was very nice, but not very attentive. However, I could see that the place was relatively understaffed, and having been a waitress myself for years, I understand the position that she was in (especially if she was a manager stepping in). We waited a very long time for our food to come out, and when we got our food, our wings were less than satisfactory. They were so over cooked that it was hard to even take a bite. A few of the wings were burnt down to the bone. The sauce was fine, but it could barely cover up the taste and texture of burnt, rubbery chicken. The bleu cheese was also quite warm, which indicated that the wings may have been sitting on a hot table for a long time. I'm not sure if I will be coming back to order wings anytime soon, because I can't be certain that they won't be burnt again.

Its so rare that I have an aweful experience dining but this was one of them. I'm a frequent visitor of Fridays and I've always been a fan. But recently the service has been so bad. I'm not sure if there has been a change of management/kitchen staff/ wait staff but today's visit was a waste of time and money. The food was stale and underdone, the entrees were served way before the appetizers. When the apps finally came they were cold (soups) and the flat bread was stale.  The steak was more rare than medium well. The portion were dramatically smaller than usual.  The waiter brought my sizzling chicken and shrimp before they put the shrimp & mashes potatoes on it and just have me a plate of chicken. He then had to take it back and I had to wait some more.  And as expected, the receipt was all kinds of messed up. Should've went elsewhere, but at least the family spent time together.

My best friend and I always eat here when we're not sure what we want to eat and the servers have always been more than helpful. We've probably ordered everything on the menu, so my top choices: - Chipotle Yucutan Salad (i forget the name, but close!) - Mozzarella Sticks (so melty!) - Spinach Florentine Flatbread (better than the dip) Really good food for a chain restaurant! :)
Their happy hour sucks! You'll wait forever and their best selection for specials are so bad.

So disappointed in this place. Was here last night with two of my friends so we could have a girls night and catch up on life and the service could not have been worse. We sat down by the bar and waited till 10 to order drinks for happy hour, and I decided to get endless apps. I, was more than certain that when I order endless apps, the first thing I'd order would be a regular size portion and there after, whatever I put in to order would be half the size, or at least smaller portions. Fine. I was told to order two endless app dishes, thinking I'd get a whole quesadilla and a regular size portion of boneless bites. Guess what, I sure as hell didn't get that, in fact I got less than half the size portion of each dish I ordered....oh and it took about 25 minutes for the food to come out, so when it did, i take a bite out of my food. It's between cool and lukewarm at best. I was pissed. Both at the portion size and the temperature I got my food, but I kept my mouth shut, dealt with it and ate it. Our server (don't remember her name) was no freaking better. She probably came to check on our table a total of 5 times. Totally unacceptable. Oh and she didn't even clear the empty plates off the table when we finished with the first round of apps. Making us piles plates one on another. Definitely not okay. Our bill came up to $50 and guess what we left a $5 tip. Why? Service and attentiveness. I didn't even feel bad, I used to be a server too where I was paid $1.18 an hour and most times, my checks were void and my only income was tips. Since this was the case, when it came to service, I'd bust my ass to make that tip and make sure I was tipped. But also make sure my tables and the guests were happy with everything. To make sure all was how they wanted it. To make sure their glasses were filled..not half ass a job you don't give a shit about and magically hope that a table would leave you a 18-20% tip on shit service. Doesn't work like that unfortunately. All in all, this specific Friday's has gone to the dump and I won't be returning to this location.

Initially came here just to sit by the bar to watch the football games but the bar was packed and all the tables around. Since the games were on the hostess said they wouldn't even know when a table would be available, completely understanding.  For starters I ordered the strawberry lemonade which I highly recommend. (they charge you .75c after for every refill) I also got the clam chowder soup, not that great. It was okay but I would def not order it again.  One thing that really turned me off was their silverware. Water spots all over, looks pretty gross. I opened three other rolled up silverware until I found a decent one.  Again I know this should be expected obviously I'm not at a five star restaurant but at least keep the silverware somewhat decent looking.  For my meal I ordered the rib eye steak & lobster tail, with baked Potatoe and rice as my two sides. I ordered my steak medium well, and after eating my lobster I stared to cut up my steak and in the inside was still pretty pink (Huge turn off) I didn't say anything because it was not bleeding but it def should've been cooked better. I just continued to eat the rest of my food and decided to take the steak to go.  Our waiter was so nice and friendly, if he wouldn't have been so nice I would've prob complained about the silverware and my steak. I never went to be that person but sometimes it ruins your whole dining experience. The baked potatoe, rice and lobster were delicious which honestly I wouldn't expect it. Glad I went with that choice instead of a burger.   I can't say I would never come back, because I will but most likely only to have appetizers and drinks at the bar.

Met some friends here on a monday night at 8pm.   Waited for them in the bar which was very noisy.  Lots of TV's with sports on which hubby liked.  Fast service on the drinks, but the appetizer took 15 mins.    We moved to a booth in the main area which was much more quiet.  Service was great.   Spinach flatbread was tasty but was dry, needed marinara sauce to dip.   Ribs were dry.  Bourbon Mahi mahi with spinach and rice was deliciously flavored but a little dry too.  But the butter sauce helped.   Decent place but not great.

So I am a bit spoiled and not a fan of chain restaurants but I did stop here for a quick lunch and I found the bartender to be polite and friendly. He recommended a few veggie items and I ended up liking what I had. The on,y down side to the place was the fact that I had a waitress coughing all over and saying very loudly how sick she was! Thank God she wasn't touching my food!

Last night, I held my sons Birthday party here. We got 1 waiter for 35 people, and he rocked it! Thanks to our waiter Manny for awesome service, and the General Manager as well. Things couldnt have gone better! We have always come to this location and had never had any issues, so I wasnt surprised...Dont hesitate to hold any event here with a large group. Just call ahead for seating preps, and they'll make it happen! 5 stars all around.

The service at this place absolutely sucks and the food disgusting.. the mozzarella sticks are a mush of poor product they call cheese. The potato skins had no potatoes they were so over cooked and the pot stickers were still cold and the wrappers were not all the way done... this is not my first bad experience here but it will be my last!!

Came here last night with my husband to the newly Fridays ( haven't been here in years) but decided to give the chain restaurant try. We finally get our food and not our drinks first which was weird, then I mention to our waiter " we're just waiting for our drinks right ?" And he just give us this confused look and says, " oh" without a sorry comes with our drinks clearly was made a while ago and again no sorry. After our meal we decided to get dessert and our waiter just pointed at the dessert tab on our table and said " oh everything is here" and walked away. You can tell he just didn't care about his job which I get dealing with so many people, but come on customer service. After receiving our bill which was pretty high for a chain restaurant I rather pay more at a place we're we'll receive proper customer service and not straws thrown at us and feeling ignored. Sorry TGI Friday's not coming back : (

All I have to say is..... Thank God It's Friday!.. The food was nicely prepared and the waitress treated us very kindly. There was a French fri issue but that was easily squared away by the waitress. This is probably my favorite commercial restaurant. I will always recommend Friday's to all my friends and family.

My best experiences here are at Happy Hour at the bar. Especially when I am able to find a seat! Their drinks are pretty good and reasonably priced and after a while of coming here, (especially since it so close to home) you become friends with the bartenders, who are extremely friendly. When I do eat, it is usually apps, wings etc.  I've eaten in the dinning area before but my experience there hasn't been the greatest in regards to service or cleanliness, so I will judge them from what I experience the most which is the bar.

Great night with great food and service! Kaela is a awesome waitress. She was very nice and attentive! She made sure that our drinks were refilled without us even asking! Of course we ordered the endless apps and of course she made sure our table and bellies were full of food!

Just a tip- walking around the restaurant as a waitress stuffing your face with your hands and then continuing to work is not the best look. As a waitress of 10 years I know we all eat during our shift but please, girl, in front of customers? At least make it a point to wash your hands afterwards. Then she continued to yell at another waitress from across the room. I know my manager would be MORTIFIED if this was his place. The manager ought to spend a day here because he/she clearly doesn't.... The only reason I'm giving this place two stars is because that class act of a girl was not our waitress (ours was wonderful) and because our appetizer was delicious; the burger that came without the avocado I ordered, not so much. I don't know why I even came here after the first average experience. Needless to say, save yourself the over-priced burger and walk across the street to Zinburger.

Their happy hour is great which is why I usually come here. But I recently just went on a Sunday and they close at 1am, but they started closing down at 12am, turned off all the tvs, called last call and one of the bartenders said "everyone finish up cause you gotta get outta here!" I've never experienced such rude behavior here. I don't know why she wanted to kick everyone out when they weren't even closed yet.

Not my favorite Friday's, however its in an extremely convenient location, right on RT3.  Also its right next to one of my favorite wine stores which I always walk into after  I eat or if there is a wait for a table.  Tends to pack up on weekends and thursday nights. Food is ok here and service is pretty quick and accurate.  Wait staff is very young and anxious.    The parking tends to pack up so you might park a bit far and walk, usually isn't an issue though.  3 Stars overall, nothing to write home about.
The hostess had the nastiest attitude. Waitress was very nice. Food was absolutely disgusting. Lettuce was hard and crumbling... the tomato was moldy... the avocado looked days old. So gross

So here's basically what happened. My wife and I entered this "restaurant" at 10:08pm on a Wed, it was fairly empty but despite the late mid day night lack thereof, the servers were busy staring at the ceiling and trying to figure out how to change the channel on one of the TVs awkwardly placed In the center of the restaurant. After about 15 minutes, a gentlemen came by and took our order. Here's a Madden break down.  Boneless wings: not bad, hard to screw up chicken drenched in sodium sauce and creamy cheese  Wedge salad: too simple to screw up  Flat iron steak: had an awkward aftertaste. Should change the name too awkward after taste steak.  Grilled chicken Cobb: as mediocre as Obamas first term. They didn't have the decency to mix the salad. It looked like someone sampled the salad bar at an old charlie Browns.  Mac and cheese: more like Mac and teeeeeeese.  Sweet potato fries: soggier than a roll of Toilet paper dropped in the toilet.  Dessert: yea ok, check please.  If you do decide to go here, I recc getting plenty of water to wash down the sodium infused high calorie dishes.  Stay clear, go for a beer.

Ordered the Pick Three: wings, potstickers, and loaded potato skins.  The potato skins were atrocious. I'm not even sure it was made with a real potato. The cheese was thick and cold, and it wasn't even melted. It was as though I was served leftovers from last night. Not to mention the lack of bacon.  The potstickers had a plastic-type of texture and were cold. The only decent, edable thing on the plate was the wings. When I informed our server, she was apologetic but didn't offer a new plate. I asked about a new plate of fresh food and she confirmed. Later, she brought the bill, but never brought our new plate of food.  When I asked about it, she was clueless LOL. I won't even start about how our server forgot our beverages.  NEVER will I come back here..

Attended this Friday's last night with about 7 friends and we were assisted by the sever i don't recall her name but i truly wish i could recall because she was awesome. She assisted us with everything, she made sure all the food came out correctly, and if it did not she corrected the issue. I live about 20 mins away from this Friday's and there is one closer to me but i have experienced terrible service there more than once so i would rather attended the one in Clifton even though is further. I can truly say this Friday's has a different atmosphere than any one I have even attended prior to and from now this is the restaurant i will be attending.

We have been coming to this TGI Friday's forever and always got good food, good prices and good drinks and the servers are usually professional and helpful (ask for Debi if you can, she is an everything that a server should be.    Sweet, friendly,  brings you what you need before you even ask for it.  She is amazing )  We noticed that they were having a Steak and Lobster special from 4-6 pm for $14.99.  About a 6 oz. Sirloin, small lobster tail plus two sides.  While my husband's steak was good, mine was so chewy and mostly grizzle - it was inedible.    I know we are talking "chain restaurant special" but Outback runs the same type of sirloin at the same price that is a much better cut of meat.  The sides were good (I got the rice pilaf and spinach, hubby got Parmesan fries, these are very yummy ) which were good.  Our server Amanda was great,  hard working and professional.    When she came by to see if there was anything else we needed I told her the steak wad not good, she apologized and said she would tell the manager.  She dropped the check off and said the manager would be over, but he/she  never showed.  Oh well.  Fridays has a great loyalty program (Give me more Stripes) that awards points for dollars spent that can redeemed for free entrees and other free food)  They also send alot of coupons via email for Buy one/Get one free entrees.  Sometimes any entree , sometimes a rack of a ribs.  Which is what I am getting next time.  I love Friday's ribs especially the Jack Daniels basted ribs.  These are great.   Stick to what's good is always the best way to go.  Sometimes we get the White chocolate cheesecake for dessert but Hubby was in the mood for Cups so off we went.  Review to follow......

I went to have a quick bite with my fiancé but I ended up staying for hour longer because of the great service I received from the moment I walked in. The host at the front was ready friendly and my waiter Manny who mentioned was new was super courteous, attentive, and friendly.  He made the experience worth coming back another time. The food was great and the drinks had me feeling nice. Would highly recommend.

Man talk about horrible service, let's get straight to the point. The booth they sat us in was still dirty, the appetizer sampler came out 30min after we ordered it, I had to asked the waitress several times where was our food, the table behind us and to the right of us who came in after us finished their appetizers and dinner and were on to dessert before we received our appetizer that I asked the waitress for 15min before, she then sent the manager over who asked us what we order then 10min later he had some one else bring it out to us. The appetizer was the best part..... Now onto the fun.... The food of course came out dry and extra cooked thanks to the heat lamp Lol. Why would you bring us food that was sitting in the window for 15min?.... Talk about disappointed this service was pitifully. So at the end of service we asked the waitress for the check and again she forgot (Lol go figure right). When she brought us the bill the manager comped it 20%.... Wow gee thanks... You could have at least comped the appetizer since that's the cause of the problem, but common sense isn't working tonight I see.  On the bright side, the waitress knew she screwed up and did try to fix it by being overly attentive.... However once the damage is done it done.......
Terrible!!!! Stood at the "to go" corner for 5 min and nobody took my order. They always do that every time I come here. But today just pushed me over the edge. They suck!!!

I come here often, I love our server Debbie  her professionalism  makes  the evening   worth while. I tend to get the ribs ,they are fall of the bone good,  I've never had any problems with any of the support  staff. The place is great

TGIF is an alright place. It's one of those places that I can go for lunch but I usually choose not to because there are better places in the area for the same price. We found ourselves here with a party of 30 for their endless appetizers though so here I am after 10 years of not having TGIF.  The price is decorated nicely. the seats are comfy. I think overall the atmosphere is good. We had a group of 30 and that hard for them to fit....it was def. very crowded. They gave us a giant long table against a wall so basically people sitting inside against the wall couldn't get out. We were smart enough to cut the tables into smaller sets so people can slip out in the middle (Idk they didn't do that to start with). We ordered a ton of the appetizers. Lots of different deals. I appreciate their Happy Hour Prices - lots of 1/2 price stuff, endless appetizers for $10, and $1.50 things. Their sliders were good, wings were good with all the different sauces, potato skins were good too. Not a huge fan of the fried string beans (also don't think it's worth the price), or the mozz sticks. I liked the Gold Medalist Smoothie. One problem I have with TGIF is they don't list prices on half of their drinks menu. Like, what? When I asked the wait staff, they were unsure of the exact price and gave me estimates. ..... I don't understand why it's a thing to not list prices on the menu in your restaurant. I know people do it on their online menus but their real ones? Are you trying to tell me it's free? Or trying to trick me into getting something expensive? The wait staff was very nice and friendly. Alex was our waitress and she was really great-flexible with our orders and didn't get frustrated with our large group. They had like 2-3 waiters/waitresses for our entire group. That went well.  TGIF is an alright place. Average. 3 stars are about right.

This place has gone downhill. They used to have good food and better service but the last few times I've been here not only were the bartenders less than helpful but the food quality wasn't that good either.  I used to get one of their specials Jack Daniels steak and shrimp but they don't even offer that anymore.
Good food. Love that there's TVs all over so I was able to watch the game while I enjoyed my dinner.

Went to the bar for a Georgia Peach Long Island ice tea and was greeted by a suave handsome young man named Ryan. After he made me the best drink of my life he went on to assure me that he would help me find the perfect food to accompany my beverage. I decided on the crispy green bean fries after he swayed me with his impressive vocabulary and knowledge about the American traditional cuisine. I have to say, the food was alright but the baked potatoes were dry and terrible. Someone should do something about that. Other than that what great experience and I will definitely be back.

Stopped for a quick bite on the way home from the city. Ordered a mojito and it took 20 minutes to get the drink and when it finally arrived with the dinner it was made with whiskey instead of rum! Both meals were cold when they arrived, chicken was tough and chewy. Brownie dessert was stale, burnt and brought to the table with the ice cream and whipped cream melted in a puddle. Avoid this place and save your money.
Great place to go on a summer afternoon. The service was great and the outdoor seating at the tiki bar was perfect for enjoying drinks, food and great music.

The food was great the service was awesome. The waiters were great. My children and I were sitting below an air condition vent and it was cold. The waiter immediately turn it down. the food was hot and tasty. I love TGI Friday.

Been to this place quite a few times, mostly for lunch. It's kind of quiet and a little secluded so there is never really a wait to be seated. The drinks are pretty darn good and food isn't bad. The service is very good with servers only stopping by once every so often to ask how is everything. The location is a little weird since you have to go up a ramp park and then go downstairs and around to the front door. Overall, it is a decent place.

If you love food don't come here part 2... I thought that the last time I had tgi Fridays was bad because of a different location but this one was WORSE... We requested a booth and they tried sitting Us . At a table then when they tried moving us again they brought us to a different table ..3 time is the charm when we got sat finally at a booth ... Our waitress has been the worst waitress of all time ..shoutout for her for not knowing shit about the food like you have one job.. We waited about 45 min for appetizers... Everything we ordered was horrible looking and tasted like shit in a toilet ..... The  beef tostadas was literally cat food.. I feed that to my cat everyday and it smelled like a sweaty sock... Can't wait to go home and throw up profusely!!!!ps our waitress should be fired she's just talking to people she knows instead of taking the thousands of plates we have on our table

The only reason why I'm giving this any stars is because it will not allow me to proceed unless I do so. This is by far the worst and most gross experience I have ever had ! We came in a group of 4 to celebrate a friends birthday . We were sat in the dinning area and when our waiter by the name of Paul came to greet us , we mentioned we came for happy hour , he mentioned there was no happy hour at 5:00 P.M and that it starts at 7-10. After all we came for a good time and drink so we decided to order at regular price , to only get a margarita with a bug ! Yes a bug !!!!!!! Then we asked for a manager he left and said ughhhhh . We got our manager by the name of Chris and we explained the situation and showed him the bug. He apologized and just said ohh sorry about that and immediately took the cup. Then he stated ,happy hour was not available until 7 -10 by this time is was about 6 .  He was very unprofessional and the entire way everything was handled was ridiculous ! We will never , ever visit another Fridays .

I went to this restaurant for the first time on a Tuesday night for dinner with my mother. We ordered steak and lobster tails for dinner which was served quickly and was absolutely delicious. The problem is the staff were a bunch of uncaged animals. They were playfully chasing each other around the restaurant knocking into tables and chairs, screaming, and yelling to each other across the room. They were obnoxious, disruptive, and rude.  We will NEVER go back.

This one holds sentimental value.  It's a standard TGIs except at this one, they remember you at the bar- friendly, appropriately flirty, and fun to be at. Quick, attentive service, even at the high-tops, and no matter what they never rush you. Reliable, easy, and always warm inside.

A few weeks ago, 8/24/15, My wife and I went to Friday's at Clifton NJ. Been there several times never had a problem until now. The waitress ask me what I wanted to drink, I requested a vodka martini with olives, which is my usual. A few minutes later a different waiter brought the vodka in a regular glass without the olives. When I mention to him why not a vodka martini glass, he gave me an attitude. took the glass, threw away the straw in front of me and left.  The waiter return with the martini glass with a "shot" of vodka and still no olives. I had to request again for the olives. The waitress came back and said that I ordered a straight vodka and not a martini. When I spoke to the manager he basically ask me if I was sure that I ask vodka martini. Basically he called me a liar. Since when a manager questions a customer?  The waitress didn't even bother to offer dessert. In a piss attitude gave me the bill and walked away.  In addition, the picture in the menu shows a burger with chorizo which I ordered. When I received my burger I couldn't see or taste the chorizo. Just waiting 10 mixtures and no one showed up. Waiters looked at us and just totally ignored us. Horrible I usually do not have this experience. It shows that they are understaffed and also they do not care for their customers.  I would ask for the manager but no one is even acknowledging us

I haven't written a review in a long time, but now is the time.  I love T.G.I. Friday's, especially the amazing boneless buffalo bites, but I'm so disappointed in last night's entree.  I ordered the dragonfly salmon with a side of ginger-lime slaw instead of rice.     If that is the amount of rice I would have gotten then I would have ordered the rice for portion control.  But to give the equivalent of about an 1/8 of cup of slaw is ridiculous.  I was so shocked that I really thought it was a joke.  A little more ginger-lime slaw and I wouldn't have brought home a doggy bag.  If I had the balls to ask the waitress for more I would have, but I shouldn't have had to in the first place.   There are a lot of other restaurants near this T.G.I. Friday's and you better believe I will remember this entree neglect next time I think to eat here.

Went to T.G.I Friday's  for a business lunch and was greeted immediately. My associate was already there so I joined him at his table.          I ordered a bacon cheeseburger with fries and an unsweetened iced tea. The server was very friendly but no specials were suggested. He asked how I wanted my burger (to which I replied medium) and went to place the order.    My iced tea was brought out pretty quick but there was no ice in my glass. The burger took what seemed like forever and was not cooked properly. It was well done not medium. The fries were seasoned well.     The environment was clean and the service was worth the price. All in all it was an average meal at an average restaurant.

Me and a few friends stopped by here today to get some burgers. Overall,  the burgers were pretty darn good. Lemonade, I seriously didn't like.  Too sour! Fries were good as well and boneless buffalo wings tasted good, although I felt the burgers should have been cheaper . Nonetheless, I will return but I hope the lemonade taste better than last time.

I've only eaten at the bar here, never had a reg. Table. I come mainly for happy hour. I love the ultimate margaritas and the garlic parmesan wings! With the happy hour its a good deal. Service is hit or miss. But for the most part I've had a good experience. I love watching football in the bar too.

My favorite Fridays to visit. I usually go to the bar so I don't know much about the actual restaurant servers. Each of the bartenders are awesome but my favorite is Mario. He's awesome and we usually talk about sports or anything else going on. Lisa is another bartender and is friendly as well. The servers who bring out the food when you order are very nice an friendly.  My only complaint is that they downsized on the Jack Daniels Burger. They now give you half the fries they used to give an the burger seems a little smaller as well. The only thing that hasn't changed about it is the price. Regardless I still love it and I consider myself a regular even though I'm sure Mario & Lisa see a lot of the same people.  Would recommend for anyone who just wanted a drink and food to watch a game.  (Wednesdays are trivia night)
They only get two stars because the food was fine. But the service here is terrible. Not attentive at all. They don't value customer service at this location.

Ok the only thing I wanna talk about is service , from my few times being here at the bar, service has been horrendous, bartenders literally look at you and then walk away , your glass will empty for a while, and at times there are no bartenders present while there's a full bar, that's just not right. Happy hour is decent, half off on appetizers and and discounted tap beers and mixed drinks, which brings the Crowd Again service at the bar has been an issue hope it gets addressed

Love the Happy Hour... especially all day on Sunday.  Half priced apps, $1.50 basket of fries and $1.50 (I think?) sliders.  Forget what the drink prices were, I believe domestic beers were around $3.  Nachos were great.  HOWEVER, I thought the service was horrible! I've been here a few time, whether it be slow or a little bit busier, services has always been lacking.  Sure, I can understand it taking more than a few minutes to get us our beers from the bar, but not bringing over waters either, when we specifically asked for them, is somewhat unacceptable.  Also thought the TVs in the bar area were kind of on the smaller side for a place that boasts football specials.  We like snacking on some apps and drinking a few beers so the service won't keep us away, it just leaves something to be desired.
I come here often...typical chain restaurant...they currently have a 3 course $12.99/16.99 dinner menu...it's not given to you by the hostess...so make sure you ask for it.

Went here for happy hour on 10/22.  Waiter was great but we were served boneless buffalo wings that were literally raw inside.  Waiter took care of it as soon as we mentioned it by getting us a new plate and apologizing.  Would have been nice if the manager came by to apologize since he clearly saw the waiter taking our raw chicken away.  Other food we got was cooked correctly and tasted great.

Soooooo this is where customer service comes to die eh? Went here over the past weekend mostly because we hadn't been to this place in a long time and the last time it was pretty decent. As soon as we got in we were offered immediate seating by the bar which would also give us half priced drinks and half priced appetizers so we said why not. A couple minutes after we got seated the waiter arrived and took the order for our drinks and the appetizer. The drinks didn't show up for over 5 minutes and remember we are right by the bar. The appetizer was good enough and after a little while the entrées showed up. The food itself was fine, not bad just nothing to write home about. Then things started to go down hill fast, after waiting for a good couple minutes we were able to get the waiters attention for another drink which also took a minute to get there. When the waiter arrived with it i asked if i could have the remainder of my meal to go.  Guy disappears and doesn't come back until 10 minutes later when we try to get his attention to ask for the check. I ask again to have my food packaged up and he says fine then comes back 5-10 minutes later and drops a Styrofoam container on the table with a bag and the check. Kinda rude but at this point we just wanted to get the hell out of the there when we notice on the check that they charge full price for the drinks and appetizers so after getting this dude again we ask him to explain whats the big deal. He tells us that the offer we given at the door only covered select drinks and appetizers. I shouldn't have to deal with disclaimers when going out to eat damnit. We got the dude to fix the check...which took another unreasonably long period of time and then we had to wait another eternity for him to ring it up.  If it was busy I could kinda understand but there were quite a few empty tables and just a few people at the bar! I felt like I was being held hostage there! Never again don't do it to yourself people, stay away!!!

Eff you TGI Fridays. After eating at Zinburger (which was really good, by the way) with the hubby and a few friends we decided we wanted a few drinks. I will never ever come back to this place. Or I'll have tp bring my own dishes next time. TGI Fridays...I curse you. (said with a horrible gyspy-esque accent)

So I went here 3 times!! The first time is sucked but I chalked it up to they were busy. The second time I went was on a weekend @ about 1pm which isn't peak hr so I figured the food would be pretty decent. NOT!!!! My chicken was cold, my shrimp were cold, my baked potato was disgusting it was horrible. I sent it all back and just ordered hot wings.  They sucked too but not as bad. I went a 3rd time on the 4th of July @ about 11:30 @ night. They didn't have the drink I wanted and I was informed they ran out yesterday!!! YESTERDAY REALLY??!!! Ummm ok. When I ordered my food they were out of baked potatoes. Wow really never been to a Fridays that ran out of baked potatoes. My ribs were horrible. Which are usually good @ any other Fridays. I didn't tell the manager cause for 1 I didn't want a free nasty meal from here and 2 I knew I would never return. They have struck out 3 times with me I will never go back and they will never get my hard earned money for that nasty food ever again. I'm sure it's just this Fridays cause I never had a problem anywhere else. Don't waste ya time going there. There's a few different other restaurants in the plaza (like Joe's Crab Shack) that are 1000 times better!!! Wish I could give this a 1/2 star or no stars!!

I went two weekends ago to eat for cheap but we found out when we got there that they got rid of the 3 for ten -___-  I was really upset about this. Also, I ordered fajitas. It was the worst fajitas I have ever had. I should've known not to order fajitas from an american restaurant. They didn't have refried beans, the rice tasted bad and so did the black beans... it tasted like plastic. The fajitas at chevy's which is right by there are so much better. That night I completely regretted going to TGIF's. I mean the service was decent but the food sucked- maybe it was just what  I ordered because I went a few months ago and the jack daniels burger I ate was good.

My friends and I decided to go out for a bite after being stuck inside for a while because of Superstorm Sandy.  We decide to go to Friday's and what a bad mistake.  We order the fried string beans and there were about 10 pieces on the plate and to boot there was a hair.  REALLY!!!!!!  We called over the waitress and she gladly took the plate away.  We should have left at that point, but we were out so we stayed.  The second batch of fried string beans were better (no hair) but the plate that the beans were on was dirty.  It seemed that they took the next available plate, again REALLY!!!!!  Don't you wash your dishes?  When our entrees came, again the dishes that the food were on were dirty.  The food was not great.  Then when we got the bill we had been charged twice for the beans but at the bottom they subtracted one of the string beans, again REALLY!!!! You are charging us for string beans when there was a hair on the plate.  We told the waitress about the double charge and that they only removed the one string bean order and the waitress was not happy but she did tell her boss and they removed the other order of string beans. BAD night overall.  We should have left when we had the chance. Never going back again.

I've been here quite a few times before as it's close to several places that I go to. Normally I have a normal, TGI Fridays experience. Mediocre food, that just happens to taste ok, and it's relatively cheap. My mother and I went there for dinner last night and if it wasn't for other experiences there being better, this review would have been one star. We arrive around 8PM, maybe a little before. We waited at the front desk, stand thingy for about 5 minutes before someone seated us, mind you the place was less than half full. Ok...The waiter comes and asks for our drink order which was just water with lemon and that comes out in a timely fashion. Here's where the visit really starts to go south. We order our meals (appetizers and entrees) and it takes about 25 minutes for our apps to come out. Now, I've dined at very high end places in my life and I know that perfection takes time (not that I was expecting perfection at a TGI Fridays, but you know what I mean) but i've still never waited more than 15 minutes for an appetizer (especially one that was probably premade and frozen). FInally the apps get to us. I forgot something in my car so I ran out and came back and my mom tells me that they had brought our entrees out and she sent them back considering we had only had our appetizers for all of 2 minutes. 10 minutes later our entrees come out cold of course. We were going to send them back but it wasn't even worth it. We ate some of our food, gave a pretty crappy tip and left. I can't even say that I won't be back here, because I probably will be. But hopefully they bring their C game like they normally do rather than the F game they brought last night.
out to tgi friday..don't feel like cooking tonight

We were greeted by a guy with a great personality, who offered us outdoor seating on the warm evening we were there.  We opted for a booth, instead. Being to several Friday's before, this one's no different.  We had the turkey burger with house chips.  It was fine. Also, the Santa fe chicken salad was good also, except... I really wish they could put more effort into garnishing the plates coming off the line.  There was none to be found on this salad, which just made it look like a pile of tossed salad massed in the center of a stark white plate. Parsley, tomato, chives...anything would have helped make this good salad that much better through the visuals!! That's it.  Standard Fridays stuff here...which, I guess, is good.

Don't come here during the busy hours as its a disaster. People pile in the front waiting area and kind of end up where people are seated eating. I've seen people at their tables eating with butts in their face. The food itself is good when it comes out fresh. TGIF seems to go through waiters and crew fast though as I always hear apologies for the "new staff" in training every time I go. Last night was no exception. They had new food runners and I guess my dinner got lost. My parents got both their meals and mine didn't come out for another almost ten minutes. At least it tasted great when I did finally get it. Not sure if I was just starving by then though. As it took almost 10 minutes to get our drink orders in. Overall this place isn't bad though. They just seems to get overwhelmed by too many tables sat and too many new people working there.

Had to attend a wake nearby so the family decided to go there to eat. (there were three of us) hostess said hang on while I find a table for you. She disappeared so we sat down. (This was on a Monday around 5:00). I said I have no idea. Waitress was EXTREMELY courteous and made sure we never went without something to drink, napkins, etc. Food came out great. One of the better Fridays.

This place is far from being par. The service is a bunch of incompetent kids, the bartenders never seem to get my drink order right. The draft beer is always flat never cold . The food is, well you know how the food is gonna be I dont have to tell you anymore.

I'm really shocked at the bad reviews! We have eaten here a bunch of times and we always have had great tasty food and great service! Their ribs are to die for! Yummmy!! This is one of our favorite places to go out to grab a casual meal. I usually ask to come here on my birthday.   My only one complaint is that I once ordered the fried shrimp entree and in my opinion I didn't get enough shrimp. I usually wind up taking home leftovers because I'm a small person, but that time I had no leftovers to bring home and later that night I was hungry agian. But that was just that one thing on the menue. Everything else I've had was great and there is usually a lot.  I really like the atmospher too & the classic rock music they play in there. As for my husband & I we have no complaints {& I'm what you would call a 'foodie' I love to cook & I know when food is good or not!}
If you've ate at one of these type of places you know what to expect.
This place is horrible.  The food and drinks suck and the service is even worse.  Don't waste your time at this dump

Your standard TGI Friday's.  You know what you're getting when you come here.  The wife and I both had the Jack Daniels Burger which absolutely hit the spot.  We started with the Spinach Dip and my daughter had the mac and cheese from the kids menu.   Good service from our waiter who we felt bad for because we overheard him say to another waiter that the table next to us left no tip at all despite running up a $55 tab.  But again, when at TGI's, this unfortunately seems to happen.  Please people, remember that gratuity is not included in your bill, even at TGI's. Great place for a family to come and not feel bad if the kid(s) are getting a little loud.

Christmas Night dinner... Server was great but basically had to do the manager's job of damage control as well. Our orders were mistakenly delivered to some other table. Ok, mistakes happen. So we had to wait double time for the kitchen to re-make our ordered dishes. Server came and asked us if anyone (I.e., the manager) had come by to explain what had happened.  Of course, answer to that was "no" and remained that way for the rest of the night. We did get comp'd for a bowl of soup for our inconvenience (and kudos to our server for making that happen). But yet, the manager never came by to apologize on behalf of TGI Friday for the order screw-up... could not spare two minutes of time out of the near two hours we were there to even give us a "make-good" line. It left me wondering: If the manager failed to take responsibility for the shortcomings of the staff members responsible for the screw-up, then what else is that same manager failing to take responsibility for in the service granted to the customer base of this establishment by the staff under that manager's watch? It definitely makes me weary of coming back to this place with the same trust I did prior to today. Caveat emptor... BUYER BEWARE!

The food is terrible here. The two times I have been here, I've had terrible food. The rice is always dry and hard, the food is salty and cold, the meal is always overcooked and dry and hard to chew. I think the TGIFridays chain, in general, is not good. The quality of the food is declining while the prices are increasing. Haven't been to any TGIFridays since.

Typical chain restaurant. I had a Jack Daniel's Pulled Pork sandwich for lunch. It was good although that JD bbq sauce does get to you after a while. Great value because this month most sandwiches are $5.

They have some enjoyable dishes.  I particularly recommend signing up for their email "Give Me More Stripes" program, which results in them sending you coupons for excellent savings every week or two--typically either 20% off the check (excluding alcoholic and nonalcoholic drinks) or a free entrée with order of another.  Also, Stripes members can get free chips and salsa on request here, though they don't seem to advertise the fact and I learned of it only by word of mouth.

Your typical TGIF with staple Americana food.  Most dishes are calorie dense but some good ones can be found - like the bruchetta chicken.  The pot sticker and tapas appetizers are awesome.  Right now the 2 for 10 or 3 for 13/17 deals are worth it.  Bar can be a bit loud and crowded on game days and table service is occasionally slow.

We sat at the bar for at least 15 mins and we were totally ignored by the bartenders then after we finally waved one over, the bartender then carded me and told me Fridays don't accept foreign IDs  only passports. So warning if you're a tourist in USA don't eat at Fridays unless you want to walk around with the most important document you have while being in a foreign country.

T.G.I Fridays consistency is key . Good food good drinks good service. Stopped in for a Sunday lunch . To start we had the app sampler but we swapped out the buffalo wings for the jack chicken strips (always a great idea). Drinks we order a sam Octoberfest and an angry orchard but i had to switch the a boston lager because they where out of the Octoberfest. For lunch we got the jack daniels grilled chicken sandwich and the triple stack ruben. My wife enjoyed her chicken sandwich and my ruben was okay it was more rye the corned beef but i should have know better being it was a triple stack that it would be more bread but it was still tasty. There are a few places in the area that make a better ruben so i would probably go with something else next visit. Just a question are you guys pre cooking your fries now ? We both had fries with our meal and they looked okay but they seemed like they where cooked and sitting not made fresh or made to early.

Great place for happy hour appetizers. Wouldn't bother coming for full price food. Service varies so much by visit that it's impossible to really comment on. I mostly just stop in for scorching wings .

This place doesn't even deserve a star. Keep in driving. You are better off going to zin burger a couple store fronts down. The ribs were bone dry. Shrimp was fried and greasy and mashed potatoes were salty than the ocean. Avoid at all costs. One of us got sick and it was all from the food.

We came here because the soup place next door was crowed.  The hostess seemed rude and in a rush. She started greeting us before we even opened the door. We ordered the chip n dip trio (queso, hummus, and salsa) for our appetizer, which was surprisingly good for a chain, except for the salsa. We also ordered the Korean Tacos and Spicy jalapeño burger. Korean tacos came out COLD. Burger was just OK.

I'm only giving 2 stars for a reason. I haven't been here in a while. And just like the last time I had to send my food back. But this time twice. The waiter was very friendly and polite. It was the people in the kitchen who didn't know what they were doing. It took almost an hour to get my food the right way. I got a free appetizer becuz of this but that's not the point. I'm lucky that I am one of those people who can drink and don't care if I eat. I had 3 long islands. All I wanted was a burger well done. Not pink. Really people?!? Maybe your servers should be in the kitchen. not your cooks

The food was tasty and the server was pleasant, however the chef couldn't follow simple instructions like "no tomato". Everything we ordered seemed to have been inaccurate to our request in one form or another. Quite disappointing when trying to have a nice night out with family only to have discrepancy after another.

Normal Food chain restaurant/bar, but with a hint of different taste to it. How I know this, bc I have been regular at this place since so many years.... lost the count. lol;)  Its like any other Food chain restaurant but it has bigger bar area then a normal restaurant/Bar. You have a choice to sit on the bar or if you come with many people then you can grab one of those high table in the corner. Most times there is no wait at the bar area tables...which is the best part of this TGIF- More space less Waite LoL ;).  I am a very picky person when it comes to restaurants and food. Well, I started going to the TGIF one on Rt17 b/c of my friend Brian.K  use to work as a bartender. He is a very sweet guy who is good at making drinks and best customer service. He is very friendly and talkative and customers are always up and enjoying some nice conversation with good food. Also, I go to TGIF on rt 3 b/c its near to group of friends I hangout with.... servers at rt3 TGIF are also very nice and respective. They will suggest good food and drinks to you if needed. Wait staff is very young and anxious.  I went there with few friends on the day of Sandy for dinner. we waited for long time as that place was flooded with people but when we were seated our serve brought food within 10 min. He made us some good delicious food on that cold and rainy night.  First of all, this place is very convenient to everyone as its right off Rt 3 by the small shopping mall in Clifton, NJ. Every experience that I had at this TGIF made me want to write something good about the place. second of all, I like this place b/c it has HAPPY HOURs on Sundays and after 10 pm everyday around bar area, BEST EVER!!!!!!!!!. Place where you can come and quench you alcohol thirst for less $. They have beers, margaritas, Sangrias, Electric lemonade (My Fav), etc... They also have half off appetizers which includes different kinds of wings!!!!.   The only thing that really bother me at this place is that....instead of having a big bar area they should also have some big screen TV's. There Tv's are too small to watch games on a football Sunday. Atleast one big screen TV around bar area and this place with always be flooded with people.  I think overall its a nice place to hangout when needed.... well,  this is what I concluded from my experiences and I hope you experiences are positive at this place. :)

If I could give no stars I would. To start, I never even made it to a table. After waiting 7 minutes to be seated, and ignored 3 times by a waiter, and two other employees, I left the restaurant.  No wonder why the place was practically empty!  Will not go back.

I'm still not sure if Fridays' quality has been declining for the past 10+ years, or if my palate has been constantly maturing. In either case, what I remember as being a pretty great place to eat in high school is now lower in quality than certain nearby diners (Tick Tock, I'm pointing at you). Seriously, for the prices here, the food should be so much better. The menu contents have hardly changed in the last 5 - 10 years either, which makes it boring on top of being not so tasty. Add to that the annoyance of a drink menu with almost no effing prices on it, and you get a big pile of meh. I was especially annoyed when I asked to substitute a garden salad for the fries with a sandwich I ordered. The result was a few leaves of bleached iceberg, a single cucumber slice, some croutons, and a dollop of blue cheese dressing that weighed more than the entire salad itself shoved into something slightly bigger than a monkey dish... about a quarter of the size of what one expect a house salad to be. I wouldn't have minded so much except that we were charged $1.99 for this "substitution." The only reason we ended up here was because it was nearly 9 p.m. on a Sunday, but in the future I will remember that this place is just not worth it.
Really disappointed w the food. Even though our server was a sweetheart, the food was horrible & the beers were just as bad. We are definitely not coming back here!!

Walked in here after going out to dinner for some drinks and laughs.  It was one of three bars that were open until 3 a.m  in the area.  Lisa is an amazing bartender.  Quick, friendly & gets the job done.

TGI Friday's is your typical chain restaurant.  Don't get me wrong I enjoy Friday's.  Once you've been to one there's really no more surprises.  I usually like to get the boneless buffalo wings and their Jack Daniel's burger.  The prices are good and the service is usually quick and pleasant.

Put simply, this place was disgusting.  The bathrooms were atrocious, floors soaked with water and more likely urine.  No soap, no hand towels.  We sat at the bar for a drink and some food.  Bar tender completely ignored us for about 10 minutes and very unenthusiastically took our order and ran off.  We didn't see her again for at least 20 minutes.  Not sure how most bar tenders usually react but typically when you see someone with an empty drink you attempt to get them to get another to increase their tip.  Nope, nothing.  Food came was mediocre. We had some other bar tender get our check and we got out of there ASAP.  I know what I'm walking into when I go to places like Friday's but the staff and facilities was simply pathetic.

TERRIBLE! Often when you go to a chain its because of the ease, a coupon, or something they are advertising on commercials.  I went here with my friend for a quick and easy choice.  Our appetizer (shrimp) was undercooked and mushy, they gave me the wrong flavor drink, my salmon was overcooked, the service was terrible (though it was a busy friday night), and even though we barely ate any of our food and said why - they didnt offer to do anything to make up for it. Never going back to this one again.

The service was pretty decent today. My friend and I walked up to the front door and a older gentlemen (who worked for Friday's) opened the door for us. That was nice.  We were then greeted by the hostess and taken to our table. The food was hot and the young server who took care of us tried her best to give us good service. On the other hand, my alcoholic beverage was terrible. I forget the name. But it wasn't worth remembering.  I don't expect much from Friday's because it's basically a sports bar/restaurant. They serve freezer food and cheap drinks. It's as good as it gets. I'll come back here again.

What happened to this place! Staff could care less about its customers.  Place doesn't get crowded anymore.  Food menu items are just strange And the food is seriously below decent.  Sorry but I think this place went downhill.

It's usually standard service here in the end, food and drinks come in a reasonable time.  You could save a couple of bucks if you order the bucket of beers instead of ordering individually. The jumbo shrimp cocktail though isn't as jumbo as I thought it would be, they're about the size of those ones you get pre-cooked with the sauce at the market.

This was my first time and my last time at Fridays, I had a gift card I wanted to use. What started off our bad experience was we got too our table it took us 15-20 for someone to notice that we were ready to order. Our drinks came out very quickly, then we ordered, we sat there what seemed like a half hour for our food to finally reach us. The was a party that was sitted after us and there food reached them before us. The food I have to say was very tasty, I cant remember the last time I was at a Fridays, but I did enjoy my meal. I think the management needs to retrain there employees here on customer service, because this business is seriously lacking in that department.

Typically, we all liked Fridays for one reason or another at one point in our lives. Last time I went there, a month ago. I said it like 3 times, I am allergic to the seasoning please do not put seasoning on my burger or fries. I also ordered my burger medium. Burger comes back. Fries have no seasoning-I can see that. The burger, I get half way through and, come the middle, I bite into a cluster of seasoning. It's all under the cheese. I send it back. The waiter is panicking. I told him, don't worry, I am not going to die, but I am sure to get pretty sick in a few hours. He brings me a new burger. Cool. No seasoning. Burger looks a little pinker than it should. The fries-have seasoning. I stopped eating. I did not get charged for the burger, but I got insanely sick that night. I am not going to sit here and say its because I had  a few bites of a seasoned burger. I am convinced I was served bad meat.

Been here once, maybe twice over the years. Can't say I've ever been very impressed with it, or any other local Fridays.  Was part of a sting operation a few years ago where a number of area restaurants were accused of watering down their alcoholic drinks...just look up Operation Swill

You never know what you are going to get when you walk into a chain restaurant, but I have to say the service we received last night was excellent.  My boyfriend and I have been noticing the lack of customer service in general in most places that we go (I am not from the NY/NJ area and usually just blame the tri-state), but our waitress was above and beyond.  Quick, friendly, responded to our tweaks of the menu with cheer and really made what could have been an average dining experience a joy. The food was good, not outstanding, but we were certainly well fed and when another server noticed my boyfriend using the sauce from the ribs for his fries, he took it upon himself to bring a side of sauce!   Fridays, you're making great hires!

First time in TGI Friday's.  Didn't expect much and that's what I got.  Not fair to compare it to an independent restaurant,   so I'll compare it to Applebee's which is better.  We had TGI Friday's French onion soup, and neither of us liked it.  Very weak  taste with a piece of bread in it covered with melted rubber which they passed off as cheese.  It wasn't even melted in the cup as French onion soup should be.  When the waitress asked us how everything was, we said we did not like the soup , which she saw we had pushed to the side without eating.  She did take it back and did not charge us for it.  Someone else asked for a hamburger and specifically said how to build it.  They forgot the mayonnaise. For an appetizer, I had meatballs with bruschetta which was good.  But my main meal arrived just as the rest of the table was finishing their meal. And it only came because we had to bring the error to someone's attention.  It was okay, but would have been enjoyed more if I had been able to eat it while the others at the table were eating instead of having them watch me eat because they had finished eating by the time my meal arrived. From today's experience, I would say that I am not a fan.

I honestly don't expect a 5 Star meal when I go to a chain restaurant but I do expect the food to be decent. The spinach dip tasted like it had just come out of the refrigerator, the mozzarella sticks were still cold in the middle & the cheese sauce was luke warm at best. My entree came out with mayonnaise after I was very specific in asking for my sandwich to  be mayonnaise free, the waitress was frustrated I wanted a new sandwich. I asked for ranch dressing for my sweet potato fries I had to ask for that 4 times before I finally got that. Really disappointed with everything and now I remember why it's been so long since I've been there!
Food is very inconsistent and the staff is hit or miss depending on the day. They also will not give you the all you can eat appetizer menu unless you ask for it.

What I like about TGIF is the consistency. I get their turkey burger and it's been good. I find the restaurant noisy especially when it's crowded and sports are in the television. My jury is out about the bar. Yes refills for sodas are available. I haven't found an alcoholic drink I like but my friend swears by their mojitos. Best dessert is the vanilla cheesecake. It's served with whipped cream and ice cream. Pass on the coffee. It's never fresh and they don't use a strong bean.

Terrible experience. I went on a Sunday afternoon and it was quite busy, but to wait 20 minutes before even getting a waiter to my table and thirty minutes before even seeing a drink is a bit excessive and frustrating. The waiter was not apologetic at all. Didn't introduce himself and wasn't friendly at all. I ordered the jack Daniels chicken sandwich and I had to ask for jack Daniels sauce. Why? My friend ordered a steak and it was so black and burnt it was ridiculous. I wouldn't have even fed that to my nonexistent dog. Finally we ask for the check and of course it was split up incorrectly so that adds another half hour that we had to stay there and try to flag him down just to pay. Would not come back.

I  keep giving them a chance and they keep screwing up.  The food is not worth it -- I don't care if this is a chain restaurant, but, the food should be good. It taste like everything was once frozen and pushed through a convection oven then sat there and then served! It's disappointing because the drinks are decent. I won't be returning.

Okay time for my update review I went to TGI Fridays yesterday and I'm giving this review just three stars because of what happened so let me start off by saying that our server was very nice and it was very busy in the restaurant but however sadly you always have to do everything right so I ordered the $12 unlimited appetizers and surprisingly once again everything tasted great the only thing I can say is that the Memphis BBQ wings needed a little more sauce and that the peanut butter and jelly wings were surprisingly good as for the braised beef tostadas they were still very tasty and very good as well as the chicken pot stickers that were made fresh and yes I can tell they were they were pan-seared however some of my friends that received food we're not happy about the portion size and the fact that some of the food was cold so sadly that's a downgrade also I ordered a Cinnamon Toast Crunch shot however I guess in the shot glass it was hard to balance out the next year for the bartender because it did not taste like one but it was almost on the verge of tasting like it and it did take a while for just appetizers to come out however like I said it was busy so I might just let that pass overall when I come back? Yes only because I do believe they serve good food and sometimes the service can be a bit slow depending but all in all I've been to a lot worse places this really isn't that bad

I love the environment. Very nice. Great bar and tv's up the wazoo. But the customer service wasn't all that inviting. I'm not saying it was bad, but you want my money...make me feel welcomed dammit! Overall good experience. I recommend it.

Ordered  a simple  Caesar salad,  worst  salad  I have  ever  seen. Sent  back for  grilled  chicken salad  and  chicken  was  cold,  dressing  non  existent  and  even  oranges  lacked  flavor.  Good  restaurant  for  food  poisoning

As a person in this industry for 13 years,, I do not complain a lot but this was the worst experience I have had hear ,,,, my server was on drugs and it was obviously uncomfortable in front of my children !!! The food was gross looking and the taste not much to explain ,,, my glass had a black mold spot on the outside,, very gross and uncomfortable feeling the whole time!!! Get it together Friday's !!!

For a chain restaurant, this place is pretty good. A little loud, but it is TGIF. Usually, waiting time for table is short. Good service, waitresses are friendly. Their ribs and flat bread appetizer are my favorite The food is good, not outstanding but good.   The prices are good. Good place for quick lunch or  dinner.

Stay away. Place is garbage. Took my wife and son here for a late lunch on 1/30/16. The server was ok. Not overly attentive, but satisfactory. I cannot say the same about the food. The kitchen staff should be cast for the next season of Food Network's Americas worst cooks. We started with mozz sticks, boneless wings, pot stickers and soup. Everything was borderline cold and tasting of refrigerator. The entrees were horrendously bad. I got 1/2 rack and fried shrimp. The ribs were flavorless and cold. I'd say borderline gross. The shrimp were also cold and tasted like cardboard bits with breading. My wife had surf and turf. She had to send it back. The steak was a cold hockey puck and the lobster tail was a salty mess. My son had a chicken sandwich and had no complaints. I would have derived more satisfaction from taking a lit zippo to a hundred dollar bill. I've loved Friday's since I was a kid. This was without any doubt the worst experience I've ever had. This place is doo doo. I heard the Friday's in Hackensack is much better. This place will appeal to anyone who enjoys eating TV dinners without a microwave, directly out of a freezer. I'd give this place negative stars were it possible.

First time I came here even though I should've come before. Good happy hour, half apps, $3 bottles beers, $4drafts and $1.50 basket of fries! The fries were big enough for 2 people. I got it with the buffalo sauce and Parmesan garlic sauce and it hit the spot! Great service too!

Your normal chain restaurant . Great food and drink. Basic meal with great special and deals combos . Drinks are very good and special drink are really good. Beers are good and a great wines by the glass. The jack Daniels platter the best meal .

Today I visited TGIFridays hoping to have a nice evening watching Villanova crush Oklahoma and make it to the championship game; however, what i was presented with was disappointment.  We arrived at the restaurant around 6pm and sat in the bar area.  We ordered 4 orders of the Endless Apps and proceeded to order drinks off the happy hour menu.  The menu listed $3.25 for 14oz domestic draughts and bottle beers and $4.25 for 20oz domestic draughts and we asked our waiter which beers from the menu this included and he said all of them.  So we proceeded to order 2-20 oz Angry Orchards, 1- 14 oz Blue Moon, 1- 20 oz Blue Moon, and 1- 14 oz Blue Moon . When the check came it was about $94 and we were surprised to see that they were all priced at $6.25+.  I asked our waiter about this and he stated that was the domestic draught beers only included Budweiser, Coors, etc.  I explained to him that the sign said domestic beers and all the beers we ordered were produced in America and therefore are domestic beers.  He sent over the manager to speak to us and she apologized and said she would remove 2 of the Endless Apps ($10 each) from the check so that the total would have been what we expected.  However, when she dropped off the new check it was for $86 and we realized that she had only removed $8.  After mentioning this to our waiter he apologized and said he would talk to the manager again and get them removed, so we gave him our credit card.  When he returned we saw that he had still charged the credit card for the full $86 rather than removing the items that the manager said she would remove.  Overall, I am very disappointed with the service I received and the damper it put on what should have been a celebratory night watching my Nova Wildcats make it to the NCAA championship game.

For a chain restaurant, this place is pretty good. My fiance' and I are regulars for their happy hour... who doesn't want a few cheap, ice cold beers and some half-off appetizers? Usually seated fairly quickly, and there's usually a spot open in the bar area. The service hasn't disappointed yet.
